SENT.plain: A 22-year-old man with severe aplastic anemia was treated with antilymphocyte globulin, prednisone, and oxymetholone
Fourteen days after initiation of treatment he developed a fulminant mediastinal and subcutaneous emphysema leading to respiratory failure refractory to mechanical ventilation
Fiberoptic bronchoscopy showed nodular lesions typical of aspergillus
Cultures of bronchial mucus revealed Aspergillus fumigatus as the responsible pathogen
